analyzed: nyin zhag gcig gi ze'u 'brul la'o //

translated: Also, in the three years indicated by the signs of death, in the one thousand and eighty days, in the three hundred thirty-five-day months, etc., the order of subtracting each petal

analyzed: dang po la sogs pa'i 'dab ma drug po rnams la 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag lnga la sogs pa ni dang po kho nar 'bar ba yin no //
translated: is as follows: The five days of the signs of death, etc., on the first petal, etc., blaze forth at the very beginning.

analyzed: phyi nas nyen zhag 'di rnams kyi 'bab pa gzhan du gsungs te /

analyzed: nyin zhag sum cu lhag pa'i brgya phrag gsum la sogs pa rnams ji ltar rigs par 'bab par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the descent of the three hundred thirty-five-day months, etc., is in the proper order.

original: de skad du yang dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su /
analyzed: de skad du yang dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su /
translated: Thus, it says in the glorious First Buddha:

analyzed: 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag dang @296b bcas pa'i 'dab ma so so la chos nyin zhag 'dor ba'i rnam par bshad pa tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: The explanation of the petals, together with the days of the signs of death, losing Dharma days, is in the verse:

analyzed: nyi ma'i lo gsum dag las dang por nyin zhag tshogs ni mda' dang me dang 'jig rten 'dor bar byed //
translated: In three solar years, the first day of the collection of days is lost to the arrow, fire, and world.

analyzed: de las rgyu ba dang bcas nges par mda' dus rtse mo can dang mkha' ri zla ba gsum pa la'o //
translated: From that, together with the movement, it is certain that the arrow, the peak, the sky, the mountain, and the moon are in the third month.

analyzed: mig dang klu dang ri dang mda' ste nor dang lag pa bzhin du 'bab pa la ni rgyu ba yang //
translated: The movement is like the eye, the naga, the mountain, and the arrow, like wealth and the hand, falling.

analyzed: de las tshes la sogs pa'i nyin zhag tshogs rnams thams cad kyang ni gang zhig ze'u 'bru ji srid nyid //

analyzed: gsungs pa'i rnam par bshad pa las slar yang de'i phra mo 'di dbye ba shes par bya'o //

analyzed: nyi ma'i 'chi ltas kyi bshad pa'o //

analyzed: da ni rtsa ba zhes pa la sogs pa phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pas zla ba'i 'chi ltas gsungs te /
translated: Now, in half a verse beginning with “root,” he teaches the lunar death omens:

original: de la sna bug g-yon par mi mnyam pa'i dus sbyor gyis gnas la gang gi tshe nyin mtshan du rnam par ma chad par rlung 'bab pa de'i tshe zla ba'i 'chi ltas skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de la sna bug g-yon par mi mnyam pa'i dus sbyor gyis gnas la gang gi tshe nyin mtshan du rnam par ma chad par rlung 'bab pa de'i tshe zla ba'i 'chi ltas skyes pa yin te /

original: lo gsum du 'tsho ba mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: lo gsum du 'tsho ba mtshon par byed do //

analyzed: de nas zla ba gsum pa la 'jug pa na 'chi ltas nyin zhag gnyis 'bab po //

analyzed: de nas nyin zhag gnyis kyis dman ba'i zla ba gsum pa dang bzhi pa la ji ltar rigs par 'bab po //
translated: Then, after two days, the signs of death occur for three months, either the third or the fourth, as the case may be.

analyzed: de nas zla ba lnga pa la 'jug pa nas 'chi ltas nyin zhag gsum 'bab po //

analyzed: de nas nyin zhag gsum gyis dman pa'i zla ba lnga pa dang drug pa la ji ltar rigs par 'bab po //
translated: Then, after three days, the signs of death occur for three months, either the fifth or the sixth, as the case may be.

translated: Having lost six months from three years, the remaining thirty months are held, and the second petal is fully traversed.

translated: In the seventh, eighth, and ninth months, the signs of death occur for four, five, and six days, respectively, beginning with the first day of the month.

original: de nas so so'i zla ba'i dang po las @297a * //
analyzed: de nas so so'i zla ba'i dang po las @297a * //
translated: Then, from the first day of each month,

translated: The three months that are deficient by the death omens days fall in the three months that are deficient by the death omens days, and the twenty seven days are held to be the three months that are deficient by the death omens days.

original: 'dab ma gsum pa la yang dag par rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma gsum pa la yang dag par rgyu'o //
translated: They circulate in the three petals.

translated: Then, in connection with the six months of discarding the first petal, for three days of the Bahava, two days of the death omens fall in the right nostril on the twelfth petal.

original: nyin zhag gcig ni ze'u 'bru la ste /
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig ni ze'u 'bru la ste /

original: rlung thams cad rnam par gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung thams cad rnam par gcod par 'gyur ro //

original: rnam par shes pa ni 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro ste /

translated: Consciousness goes to another world.

original: zla ba'i 'chi ltas kyi bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i 'chi ltas kyi bshad pa'o //

translated: There, from the connection with the moon and sun, the time of the left nostril is blessed by time, without interruption, for one day, on top of the 96 years, 11 months, and 15 days.

analyzed: de nas g-yas kyis sna bug tu nyin zhag gnyis rnam par chad par 'bab bo //

translated: Thus, in the locations of the left and right nostrils, by the division of the left and right uneven and even [breaths], it flows for three, four, five, and six days.

analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas dag gi nam mkha' dang sa'i dkyil 'khor 'dor bar byed do //
translated: It discards the maṇḍalas of space and earth of the left and right [breaths].

analyzed: g-yas kyi sna bug la rnam par ma chad pa'i nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum dang / ze'u 'bru'i nyin zhag dang bcas pa ni /
translated: Thirty-three days descend without interruption in the right nostril, together with one day in the pistil.

analyzed: nyin zhag lnga bcu rtsa drug lhag pa'i brgya phrag bcu gcig tu 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa rnam pa thams cad pa phyag rgya chen mo'i ye shes las skyes pa'o //

analyzed: snying nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas gsungs pa kho na'i don te /

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa bral ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas sel bar byed do //

analyzed: dngos med ces bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te / de la / dngos med las byung mtshan nyid phyir //
translated: The answer is given by the words “non-entity” and so forth.🔽In this regard,

original: zhes pa ni /

original: zhes pa ni /

analyzed: dngos med ces bya ba la sogs pas gsungs pa yin no //

original: gzugs dang gzugs min rnam des grol //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs min rnam des grol //
translated: Liberated from the form and the formless.

original: zhes pa ni ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni ;

analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par 'dzin pa dang bral ba'o //

analyzed: da ni / shes rab ces pa la sogs pas sngar gsungs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ma brtags shing gnyis su med pa'i gzugs nyid du gsungs te / shes rab ni rnam @302a * //
translated: Now, by “wisdom” and so forth, the previously mentioned cause and effect are said to be non-analytical and the form of non-duality:

original: pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid do //

original: rgyu yid do //

analyzed: rgyu'i ni / yod pa dang med pa dang gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: 'bras bu zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes pa ni /

analyzed: 'gro ba'i don byed pa po'o //

original: stong nyid rgyu ni dang por te //
analyzed: stong nyid rgyu ni dang por te //

original: phyi nas dmigs med snying rje yis //

analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis ma grub pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ni /

analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas /

analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu yod na rgyas gdab par bya ba dang rgyas 'debs pa por 'gyur na /
translated: it says that if result and cause existed, there would be something to be sealed and someone who seals.

analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag nyid kyi rang bzhin ma grub pa de'i tshe ci ltar na der 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: But when they themselves are not established by nature, how could they be?

original: de la ci /
analyzed: de la ci /

analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs par rtog pa dang bral ba /

analyzed: ma brtags pa'i bde ba chen po myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: experiences the great bliss of the non-analytical state, which is a unity of the image of all aspects, which is by nature unborn and non-conceptual.
